meanings.sent1: I made a quick jotting of the important details.
meanings.sent2: She always carries a notebook for jotting down ideas.
meanings.sent3: The jotting on the sticky note made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His jotting on the paper was like a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The jotting on the whiteboard caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A quick, informal piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked for a jotting about the weekend.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed reading her jottings in the journal.
meanings.sent3: His jotting on the napkin was surprisingly poetic.
meanings.sent4: The jotting on the wall told a mysterious story.
meanings.sent5: The jotting on the poster was full of spelling mistakes.

meanings.definition: A small, quick mark or stroke.
meanings.sent1: She made a tiny jotting on the map to mark the spot.
meanings.sent2: The artist's jottings added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent3: The jotting on the sidewalk looked like a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: His jotting on the canvas transformed into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The jotting on the tree trunk stood out against the bark.
